intro: Hickelia alaotrensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hickelia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive shape. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Hickelia alaotrensis is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native habitat.
